name.text: Calculating the area of an amusement park that is pentagonal

questiontext.text:
An amusement park is the shape of a regular pentagon. Each side of the park measures \({@side@}\,\text{m}\) and the height of the pentagon park is \({@height@} \, \text{m}\). Calculate the total area of the park.

\(\text{The area of the park} =\) [[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Given:
• Side length = {@side@} m
• Height of one triangle (from the center to the midpoint of a side) = {@height@} m

\(\text{Area of pentagon} = 5 \times \text{area of one triangle}\)

Find the area of one triangle

Each triangle has:
• Base = side of the pentagon = {@side@} m
• Height = {@height@} m
\( \begin{align} \text{Area of one triangle} &= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height} \\ &= \frac{1}{2} \times {@side@} \times {@height@} \\ &= {@triangle_area@}\, \text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

Find the total area of the pentagon

\( \begin{align} \text{Total area} &= 5 \times \text{area of one triangle} \\ &= 5 \times {@triangle_area@} \\ &= {@total_area@}\, \text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

\(\text{Therefore, the total area of the pentagon-shaped park is } {@total_area@} \text{ m}^2.\)

questionnote.text:

\(\text{The height of the park}={@height@}\, \text{m}\)
